snippet: The former governor held a private meeting alongside the Conservative Political Action Conference with about three dozen evangelical organizers, conservative writers and Tea Party activists.
abstract: Mitt Romney holds a private meeting alongside the Conservative Public Action Conference with about three dozen evangelical organizers, conservative writers and Tea Party activists; largely friendly group politely grilled him about his positions on social issues and pressed him on his surprising losses during recent presidential contests; not in attendance were many of those in the conservative movement who have questioned his commitment to their causes and their absence underscores the challenge he faces in winning them over

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ERIK ECKHOLM

lead_paragraph: The former governor held a private meeting alongside the Conservative Political Action Conference with about three dozen evangelical organizers, conservative writers and Tea Party activists.

headline.seo: Romney Tries to Woo Conservatives at CPAC
headline.main: Romney Takes Conservative Leaders’ Questions in Bid to ‘Reconnect’
headline.print_headline: Romney Takes Conservative Leaders’ Questions in Bid to ‘Reconnect’
